topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550c1b146368721a54be0900#post_550c1b146368721a54be0900
Random shit: I actually had a near death experience once.

If you want to ask twenty questions about what it was like I couldn't exactly tell you cause it was one of those cases where you mind can't process what is going on so it doesn't.

I don't like talking about it cause what I could see pissed off *EVERYONE* that I told cause at the time I was super religiously born again southern baptist, everyone around me was too and the one thing that I understood from what I expereience was being told and I quote "everything's going to be okay" (in a macro sense of the world's not going to end) so imagine telling your super religious family and friends that the rapture, the anti-christ and all that would never happen and that the human race isn't going to end.

I don't often talk about it cause when I talked about it I got metaphorically crucified super hard and told that "the devil was whispering lies to you" and such.

I don't mean to start a religious discussion but I totally get why if god/s do exist why they don't show themselves publicly cause if they did you would wind up with WWIII and everyone trying to "purge" every other religion and they know damn well it would too.

What would happen if god/s made a public appearance:
God/s accidentally out themselves, "Uhh. . whoops; well in that case my facebook is <insert>; I'll be hanging out at comic con this weekend.  I can't wait to get Downey Jr.'s autograph"
Believers, "My god is real!  Murder any non-believer!  Slit their fucking throat's in their sleep!  Purge the world of heretics!"
Non-believers, "That god is evil!  Murder any believers! Slit their fucking throat's in their sleep!  Purge the world of this evil!"

I have my own religious beliefs and that so I won't but in, *BUT* the one thing I don't ever pray for is for them to reveal themselves cause I know damn well what would happen if they showed himself/herself/themselves to people.  I don't ever go, "show yourself to the world"/"show your prescense" or such at any point cause I know damn well what would happen.

Do I know if god/s are real?  Idunno.  Do I know if there's a afterlife?  Idunno.  Could it have been a hallucination and not real.  Maybe.  If it wasn't then which religion is right?  Idunno; wasn't very descriptive experience could be anyone, could have just been a hallucination from being dead at the time idunno.  All I know is that "everything's going to be okay".

And just to prove my point about how why personally I don't think they show themself/themselves I bet you $500 that there's going to be a religious fight in the next page cause people are so obsessed with being cynical about our future that the mere idea of the human race actually making it and surviving is outright blasphemy to most people.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

What if God was one of us?
Just a slob like one of us
Just a stranger on the bus

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/550c22fc6368724c562e0700#post_550c22fc6368724c562e0700
You know someone I know asked a missionary "Why do you still believe in God? Science already explained everything." 

He told him "Does something really need to be true in order for you to believe in them? My god might not be real but my faith is. And faith can do great things."

The person I know hence forth was now a believer not because know his God is real but because he has faith that his God is real. And that faith can do great things.

Do you know who that person was?
